bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to James G. Blaine, January 20, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Oath to Bond to treasury
and Jan 27
419 North Mississippi Street. Indianapolis, Indiana, January 20, 1892.
norable James G. Blaine, Secretary of State, Washington D. C.
Sir: In response to yours of the 18th, instant I will say that I have the honor of accepting the position of Minister- Resident and Consul-General to Liberia.
Enclosed please find Oath and Bond as required.

In compliance with your letter, I shall await further instructions before leaving here, but hope to be able to leave on Saturday, January 30th., which will allow one to report to you in person on the following Monday morning (over.)
In further response to your letter I will say:- 1. I was born in Cambridge City Indiana, November 17th 1853 2. I am appointed from Indiana 3. I have never resided in Liberia
Very respectfully, Your obedient servant, William D. McCoy
